title: Low Priority Queue is a Failure
body: How can you, Riot team, feel empowered as though you've achieved some great service? How can you believe that what you've done is worthwhile? If you truly believe that punishing players by these standards—a faulty version of a republic dare it even be compared to that alone... To wait 20 minutes in Low Priority Queue based on 4 peoples opinion (you know how it go) then to miss the queue pop and have to wait **_another_** 20 minutes? Ridiculous! Riot Team, you are congruent to a Big Brother government that conspiracy theorists get so hot about. Using whatever tools you can to have as much control over people as you can. Shame on you.

> then to miss the queue pop and have to wait another 20 minutes?

Well, yeah ..
How would it be a penalty if you could just go watch tv for 20 minutes and then queue for a game? How would it be a penalty if you didn't feel it?

When I spent time on Leavebuster I found that the 20 minute wait time caused more bad habits to form:

Making tea while in Q

Cooking while in Q

Doing Laundry while in Q

Going to get food while in Q

Ordering Pizza in Q

Sometimes these activities would spill over into the game out of necessity.

But leavebuster did push me into reforming. Not because of the penalty though; if anything the penalty was too high and encouraged the bad habits above because let's face it: Nobody is willing to just sit around for 20 minutes. (Although I did sit around, annoyed, for 5)

Leavebuster pushed me into reforming because that waiting time forced me to ask the following question, and later on I wondered why I'd never thought about this before:

Do I have time to play a 50 minute game all the way through?

The point is, the overall design of Leavebuster is one of the best things that has happened to ranked games.
